did.abstract: The collection contains administrative records, correspondence and publications (1979-1982) detailing the activities of the Connecticut Women's Political Caucus.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to Connecticut politics and activism. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.

acqinfo.head: Provenance and Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The materials were donated by the Schlesinger Library, a deaccession from the National Women's Political Caucus Records as being out of scope.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Founded in New Haven, Connecticut, in 1971 by Barbara G. Lifton and Lee Novick, CWPC was involved in assisting to gain public office positions. Affiliated with the National Women's Political Caucus whose records are housed in the Schlesinger Library, Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study, Harvard University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Administrative records, correspondence, and publications pertaining to the activities of the Connecticut Women's Political Caucus.
